compsim_pinns.geometry.geometry_utils module¶

compsim_pinns.geometry.geometry_utils.calculate_boundary_normals(X, geom)[source]¶

Calculates the boundary normals and the masked array to select the points on boundary which is quite useful to avoid unnecessary multiplications.

Parameters:

  • X (numpy array) – contains the coordinates of input points

  • geom (object) – contains the geometry object of the problem

Returns:

  • normals (Tensor) – contains the normal vector as a tensor

  • cond (numpy boolean array) – contains a masked array to select points on boundary

compsim_pinns.geometry.geometry_utils.calculate_boundary_normals_3D(X, geom)[source]¶

Calculates the boundary normals in 3D and the masked array to select the points on boundary which is quite useful to avoid unnecessary multiplications. This method is different compared to calculate_boundary_normals since we need to get also tangential components of the normal vector as well.

Parameters:

  • X (numpy array) – contains the coordinates of input points

  • geom (object) – contains the geometry object of the problem

Returns:

  • normals (Tensor) – contains the normal vector as a tensor

  • tangentials_1 (Tensor) – contains the first tangential vector as a tensor

  • tangentials_2 (Tensor) – contains the second tangential vector as a tensor

  • cond (numpy boolean array) – contains a masked array to select points on boundary

compsim_pinns.geometry.geometry_utils.polar_transformation_2d(sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy, X)[source]¶

Makes tranformation from cartesian to polar coordinates for stress tensor in 2D.

Parameters:

  • X (numpy array) – contains the coordinates of input points

  • sigma_xx (numpy array) – stress components in cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_yy (numpy array) – stress components in cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_xy (numpy array) – stress components in cartesian coordinates

Returns:

sigma_rr, sigma_theta, sigma_rtheta – stress components in polar coordinates

Return type:

numpy array

compsim_pinns.geometry.geometry_utils.polar_transformation_3d_cylindrical(sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz, X)[source]¶

Makes transformation from Cartesian to cylindrical coordinates for stress tensor in 3D. https://www.brown.edu/Departments/Engineering/Courses/En221/Notes/Polar_Coords/Polar_Coords.htm

Parameters:

  • X (numpy array) – contains the coordinates of input points in Cartesian coordinates (x, y, z)

  • sigma_xx (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_yy (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_zz (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_xy (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_yz (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_xz (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

Returns:

sigma_rr, sigma_thetatheta, sigma_zz, sigma_rtheta, sigma_thetaz, sigma_rz – stress components in cylindrical coordinates

Return type:

numpy arrays

compsim_pinns.geometry.geometry_utils.polar_transformation_3d_spherical(sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz, X)[source]¶

Makes transformation from Cartesian to spherical coordinates for stress tensor in 3D. https://www.brown.edu/Departments/Engineering/Courses/En221/Notes/Polar_Coords/Polar_Coords.htm

Parameters:

  • X (numpy array) – contains the coordinates of input points in Cartesian coordinates (x, y, z)

  • sigma_xx (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_yy (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_zz (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_xy (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_yz (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

  • sigma_xz (numpy arrays) – stress components in Cartesian coordinates

Returns:

sigma_rr, sigma_thetatheta, sigma_phiphi, sigma_rtheta, sigma_thetaphi, sigma_rphi – stress components in spherical coordinates

Return type:

numpy arrays
